item.title: Research on the Interpretability of Object Detection Networks
item.description: This paper completes the interpretative model of Score-CAM method on the Fast R-CNN network, and outputs the saliency map of the high impact area for each detection frame of the network. By observing the distribution of saliency degree, this paper proposes that the high saliency degree of detection frame contains both decision score information and frame location information. By detecting the outward extension of the detection frame when the objects are adjacent to each other, the relationship between the frame location and the high saliency degree inside the frame is verified by the way of frame shrinkage, which provides a theoretical basis for the optimization of the detection location using the class activation saliency map.

item.title: Research on Visual Object Tracking Technology
